intro: Erigeron nudiflorus, commonly known as the nakedflower blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron nudiflorus is known for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting local pollinators.
